sources.title: Wild Horse (1931) HOOT GIBSON
sources.description:
Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: A pioneering cowboy star of silent films, Hoot Gibson (1892-1962) ranked second only to Tom Mix in box-office draw. He made the successful transition to “talkies” but when singing cowboys became the new rage,  Gibson was regulated to B-westerns and by the 1950s, he faced financial ruin.

Stars: Hoot Gibson, Alberta Vaughn, Stepin Fetchit 
Directors: Sidney Algier, Richard Thorpe

A champion rodeo rider takes the challenge to tame a wild Palomino horse and also clear his name of murder.

metadata.Plot: Ben Hall offers $1000 for the wild Devil Horse which Jim Wright and Skeeter capture. While Jim is away, Gil Davis kills Skeeter and takes the horse. The Sheriff then arrests Jim for Skeeter's murder. But unknown to them, an outlaw witnessed the killing.
metadata.Actors: Hoot Gibson, Alberta Vaughn, Skeeter Bill Robbins
